chart 4 until the body measures 22 25 22 75 23 25 23 75 24 5 25 neck opening font neck opening cast off 16 16 18 20 22 24 center sts for the front neck opening work back and forth rs beginning at the neck opening cont to cast off 3 3 4 4 5 5 st at the begging of the next 2 rounds then 3 sts at the beginning of the next 2 rounds and then 2 stitches for the next 4 4 4 4 6 6 rs then 1 st at the beginning for the next 6 6 8 8 10 10 rs k 4rs and begin back neck opening back neck opening cast off 39 41 45 46 51 53 along the center of the back 3 working each side separately and continuing to cast off at the back of the neck every other row 2st at 1 time until the length measure k2 row in stockinette stitch cast off all remaining stitches repeat for other back shoulder finished shoulder length 23 5 24 5 25 25 26 26 75 27 5 *remember* this is an estimate and may vary based on how long your torso is or where you want the sweater to hit on your body sleeves cast on 43 45 49 51 53 55 st using your preferred provisional cast on method co 5 st using the backwards loop method and then join in the round this will be your steek k x p1 k x to beginning of round continue in above pattern for 4rows in body color while also increasing every 6 row on either side of the purl stitch m1 k p k m1 in pattern switch to us4s and complete chart 2 once chart 2 is complete switch to us3s and continue knit as established until the sleeves measures ~5 less than your desired length if the lice pattern was chosen for the body continue with that pattern as established hint the best way to tell how far you should stop is to measure the swatch that you made of chart 3 switch to us4s complete chart 3 switch to us3s and knit until the sleeve reaches the desired length sans cuffs
